an6.33:1.1: “Tonight, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me, bowed, stood to one side, and said to me:
an6.33:1.2: ‘Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.33:1.4: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for conscience, and for prudence.
an6.33:1.5: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.’
an6.33:1.6: That is what that deity said.
an6.33:1.7: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.
an6.33:2.1: Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an6.33:2.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an6.33:2.6: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
